result.execSummary:
The defendant Daniel A Mendoza was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: DNA sample previously provided, however, defendant must pay mandatory DNA surcharge.  Defendant must pay all outstanding fees and court obligations.  If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.
Obtain and maintain full time verifiable employment to the extent it does not interfere with Social Security benefits.
Alcohol assessment and follow through with recommendations. No alcohol, random UA's at discretion of agent.

Drug assessment and follow through with recommendations. No controlled substances, random UA's at discretion of agent.  Do not associate with any known drug dealers or users.  Defendant may only take medication pursuant to a prescription.

Counseling, treatment, services as deemed appropriate by agent, including Domestic Violence counseling. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation.  Firearm warning given.  Voting prohibited until sentence is complete and civil rights have been restored.

timeConds.notes: DO NOT REPORT LATE OR UNDER THE INFLUENCE OF ALCOHOL OR CONTROLLED SUBSTANCES.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY REQUIRED.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Daniel A Mendoza

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Per RASO - mandatory jail time has been served
def does not plan to seek postconviction relief
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 6, 2016 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Daniel A Mendoza in court with attorney Wendy S. Paul.  Gerad T Dougvillo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Patricia Schaefer.
Defense indicates that deft's child had emergency surgery and asks for an adj

BTC: matter to be adj  Sentencing hearing scheduled for April 29, 2016 at 11:00 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for March 4, 2016 at 10:00 am.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  Defendant ordered not to possess or control any weapons.  No contact with the victim, EJM and NLS (person, property, residence or family).   Make all court appearances on time.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

MODIFIED 11/1915 TO ALLOW NO VIOLENT CONTACT W/EJM AND NLS ALSO TO INCLUDE:   It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report directly to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.   The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.

Defendant Daniel A Mendoza in court with attorney Wendy S. Paul.  Gerad T Dougvillo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Pat Phinisee.  Waiver of Preliminary hearing filed.  Probable cause found;  bound over.
Defense request bond condition modification. 
State stands silent. 
BTC: Bond modification is granted. Bond conditions are modified to allow no violent contact w/EJM and NLS. Also to include:   It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report directly to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.   The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for January 15, 2016 at 08:15 am.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  Defendant ordered not to possess or control any weapons.  No contact with the victim, EJM and NLS (person, property, residence or family).   Make all court appearances on time.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

Defendant Daniel A Mendoza in court with attorney Wendy S. Paul.  Robert Scott Repischak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter Mark Garvin.  
State moves to dismiss the repeater enhancer in CTS 1 and 2. 
Defendant does not have an ID on person, advised to have prints and photo done at RCSO.
Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, bond set.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 19, 2015 at 08:30 am.
